page.title: 05RELIGION IN TROON.
page.content: TROON was growing so churches were needed.1815/The Seamans Mission rented a place in the Shipyard for a penny a week.1820/1823 St.Meddans rented part of the Ropeworks.1838/The Parish Church was built in Ayr St.1843 The Portland Church was built in 1856. 1883 St.Patricks Church was built in Academy St.1912/St.Ninians Church was built in Bentinck Dr.1913/The Church of Our Lady of the Assumption and St. Meddan was built in St. Meddans St.The Foundation Stone was laid in August 1910.The church was opened for worship on 8th. December.1936/The Seamans Mission moved to larger premises known as The AILSA ROAD CHURCH.The Baptist Church was known as "THE TIN KIRK".Before the First World War they formed the "BAND of HOPE".TROON was expanding so also was the religion of its new citizens.
